greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of zeta'(-5) (the derivative of Riemann's zeta function at -5) (negated).
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.15.1 Generalized Glaisher constants, p. 136-137.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
J. B. Rosser, L. Schoenfeld, Approximate formulas for some functions of prime numbers, Ill. J. Math. 6 (1) (1962) 64-94, Table IV
formula: zeta'(-n) = (BernoulliB(n+1)*HarmonicNumber(n))/(n+1) - log(A(n)), where A(n) is the n-th Bendersky constant, that is the n-th generalized Glaisher constant.
Equals 137/15120 - (gamma + log(2*Pi))/252 + 15*Zeta'(6) / (4*Pi^6), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 25 2015
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 18 2015
